questions.question: How does the LSB technique affect the visual quality of an image after hiding data?

answers.b: It slightly alters the image, but changes are usually imperceptible
answers.d: It has no effect on the image at all

explanations.a: The LSB technique does not significantly distort the image.
explanations.b: Correct. The LSB technique slightly alters the image by changing the least significant bits, but these changes are typically imperceptible to the human eye. Learn more here.
explanations.c: Hiding data does not improve image quality.
explanations.d: There is a small effect, but it's usually not noticeable.

questions.question: What is the key advantage of using the LSB technique in Steganography?

answers.a: It allows for large amounts of data to be hidden without detection
answers.b: It makes the hidden data impossible to retrieve
answers.c: It can compress data before hiding it
answers.d: It provides a high level of encryption for the hidden data

explanations.a: Correct. The LSB technique allows small amounts of data to be hidden within an image without significantly altering the image, making it difficult to detect. Learn more here.
explanations.b: The hidden data can be retrieved with the correct technique.
explanations.c: LSB does not compress data, it hides it.
explanations.d: LSB is not an encryption technique, it is a method of hiding data.

questions.question: Which of the following is a major limitation of LSB-based steganography?

answers.b: It is vulnerable to image compression and transformations
answers.c: It cannot be used with high-resolution images
answers.d: It always requires a secret key for hiding data

explanations.a: LSB can hide any binary data, not just text.
explanations.b: Correct. Image compression or format conversion often modifies the least significant bits, which can corrupt hidden data. Learn more here.
explanations.c: It works well on both low and high-resolution images.
explanations.d: A secret key is optional and not a default requirement.

questions.question: Which of these is a distinguishing factor between Steganography and Cryptography?

answers.a: Steganography hides the existence of data, while Cryptography hides the content
answers.b: Steganography uses stronger encryption algorithms than Cryptography
answers.c: Cryptography is less secure than Steganography
answers.d: Steganography works only on images, whereas Cryptography works on all files

explanations.a: Correct. Steganography conceals the fact that data is present, while Cryptography focuses on encrypting the content. Learn more here.
explanations.b: Steganography does not inherently use encryption.
explanations.c: Security depends on implementation, not the method itself.
explanations.d: Steganography is not limited to images; it can work with audio, video, and text as well.

questions.question: Which technique enhances security when using LSB-based steganography?

answers.c: Converting images to JPEG before hiding data
answers.d: Avoiding the use of any randomization techniques

explanations.a: Correct. Encrypting the data before embedding adds an extra security layer, making it harder to detect and extract hidden content. Read more here.
explanations.b: Image size alone does not improve security.
explanations.c: JPEG compression may destroy LSB data due to lossy encoding.
explanations.d: Randomization actually strengthens security, not weakens it.

questions.question: In image steganography, which file formats are generally preferred for LSB embedding?

explanations.a: JPEG uses lossy compression, which often destroys hidden data.
explanations.b: Correct. PNG and BMP are preferred because they use lossless compression, preserving hidden bits effectively. Learn more here.
explanations.c: GIF and JPEG are not reliable for LSB embedding.
explanations.d: PDF and DOCX are not suitable for image-based steganography.
